title: Wasteland Japan — Vault 811: Act 1 Story Bible
premise: Vault 811 was sold as a refuge until Japan recovered from nuclear devastation. The truth: Japan never recovered. The Vault Directorate uses the lie of 'Surface Clearance Protocol' to maintain control. The player is among the first permitted outside and discovers the deception firsthand.

vault_directorate.name: Vault Directorate
vault_directorate.desc: Internal power bloc running Vault 811. Maintains order through information control. Believes safety requires obedience — or at least the appearance of it.

shrine_wardens.name: Shrine Wardens
shrine_wardens.desc: Wasteland faction that protects old sacred sites — torii gates, shrines, temples. Anti-technology, suspicious of vault dwellers. Believe radiation is spiritual corruption.

rail_ghost_union.name: Rail Ghost Union
rail_ghost_union.desc: Salvagers and traders living in collapsed rail tunnels and derailed train carts. Pragmatic survivors who trade information and scrap. Neither hostile nor friendly by default.
rail_ghost_union.leader: Signal Mother Aiko (hinted Act 1, appears Act 2)

overseer_tanaka.name: Overseer Tanaka
overseer_tanaka.personality: Authoritative, paternalistic, hiding fear behind protocol. Genuinely believes the lie protects people.
overseer_tanaka.arc: Trust or betray the player depending on their choices

medic_yuki.name: Medic Yuki
medic_yuki.personality: Compassionate pragmatist. Cares about lives, not politics. Quietly troubled by supply shortages.
medic_yuki.arc: Ally if helped; disappointed if exploited

guard_kenji.name: Guard Kenji
guard_kenji.personality: Loyal soldier with growing doubts. Hears radio signals he can't explain. Wants someone he trusts to investigate.
guard_kenji.arc: Loyalty tested by what the player reveals

scavenger_rin.name: Scavenger Rin
scavenger_rin.role: Outside drifter sheltering in vault, lore source
scavenger_rin.personality: Quiet, observant, knows more than she lets on. Has contacts outside. May have Rail Ghost connections.
scavenger_rin.arc: Trust-gated: reveals vault secrets if player earns it

rail_ghost_contact.name: Rail Ghost Contact (Act 2 NPC, referenced in Act 1)
rail_ghost_contact.personality: Cautious trader, speaks in code phrases

warden_sentinel.name: Warden Sentinel (Act 2 NPC, referenced in Act 1)
warden_sentinel.personality: Silent, intimidating, judges by action not words

act1_themes: Truth vs Safety — Is it better to know the world is ruined, or live in the vault's comforting lie?
Loyalty vs Freedom — Obey the Directorate or forge your own path?
Survival vs Humanity — Hoard resources or share them? Exploit or cooperate?

q1_permission_lie.name: The Permission Lie
q1_permission_lie.summary: Tanaka claims surface access requires 'clearance protocol'. Player can obey or investigate the truth.

stages.20: Investigating vault logs (branch: pried into truth via Rin)

q2_medicine_outside.name: Medicine for the Outside
q2_medicine_outside.summary: Yuki needs scrap and cloth to craft Rad-Away for people outside. Player can deliver or keep supplies.

stages.10: Yuki asked for supplies (3 scrap + 2 cloth)

q3_rail_whisper.name: Rail Whisper
q3_rail_whisper.summary: Kenji detected radio pings from a collapsed rail station. Player investigates and decides who to tell.

stages.20: Player agreed to investigate rail signals
stages.31: Completed — kept secret / sided with Rail Ghosts

q4_shrine_warning.name: Shrine Warden Warning
q4_shrine_warning.summary: Reaching a torii gate triggers a warning from the Shrine Wardens. A proximity-based mini quest.

stages.10: Reached a torii gate — Shrine Wardens are watching
